### Dr. DIONYSSIOS SGOYRAS

*Director of Research Director, Head of Laboratory of Medical Microbiology at Hellenic Pasteur Institute*

Dr. D. Sgouras is a Chemist. His research interests are focused on bacterial pathogenesis and most specifically, Helicobacter pylori virulence factors and their effect on host intracellular signaling pathways, focusing mainly on epithelial cell pathogenesis and tissue remodeling during the infection.

### Dr. NADIA TODOROVA

*Research Scientist in the Institute of Nanoscience and Nanotechnologies, NCSR "Demokritos"* 

Dr. N. Todorova is a Chemical Engineer. Her research is focused on synthesis and characterization of functional 2D carbon-based materials (Graphene, MXenes, g-C3N4) and heterostructures, development of semiconductor photocatalysts for environmental (NOx removal, H2 production, CO2 reduction) and antibacterial applications.

### Dr. BEATRIZ MARTINEZ-GONZALEZ

*Research Scientist at Hellenic Pasteur Institute*

Dr. Beatriz Martinez-Gonzalez is a Pharmacist. Her work focuses on Helicobacter pylori infection, including studies of antimicrobial resistance, bacterial pathogenesis, and the effectiveness of eradication regimens. Her research also encompasses molecular microbiology and clinical surveillance related to gastrointestinal infectious diseases.

### Dr. SOPHIA VOURLI

*Senior Researcher in the Institute of Biosciences and Applications at NCSR "Demokritos"* 

Dr. S. Vourli is a Biologist. Her research focuses on microbiology and pharmacology, with expertise in antimicrobial resistance, particularly in Gram-negative bacteria and mechanisms of resistance to last-resort antibiotics. She has contributed to studies on molecular diagnostics for infections.
